text: Mario Savio (December 8, 1942 â€“ November 6, 1996) was an American activist. He was an important activist during the Berkeley Free Speech Movement. He is most famous for his speeches given at Sproul Hall, University of California, Berkeley during the 1960s counterculture movement. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American civil rights activists Category:American political activists Category:People from New York City Category:People from Berkeley, California
